title: Sandra99
author: Sandra99
content: Hello everyone,I am Sandra, and I am pleased to be a part of this community. I am interested in the world of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology and have been following the industry for quite some time now. I believe that this technology has the potential to change the world for the better, and I am excited to be a part of it.I joined bitcointalk.org to learn more about the industry, connect with like-minded individuals, and to share my own knowledge and experiences. I look forward to participating in meaningful discussions and contributing to the community in any way I can.Thank you for having me, and I look forward to interacting with everyone! any Suggestions for me ?Best regards,Sandra99

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMany Suggestions for me ?Best regards,Sandra99Hey, welcome!For next time, think better where to place your threads. This belongs to Beginners and Help section. You can move it yourself, but I have reported it to be moved anyway.Apart from that, use the forum to learn and exchange experiences and you'll be fine.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: "Following the industry" doesn't always necessarily mean that you're learning; sometimes it's just looking for coins and tokens being shilled by influencers. Hopefully you're in the former category.If you want to dig deeper..* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chapters

comments.author: Sandra99
comments.body: Dear mk4Thank you for your Detailed Reply i will read and watch your all suggestion on the links actually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss If you can't afford losses, don't invest in bitcoin/crypto or any other public market altogether; and probably don't start a business either. With fear of losses, your only choice is to get employed and work 9-5.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Welcome Sandra!Yes, we're all like minded people here that shares the same interest for bitcoin and for the whole crypto market. As you're just starting out through the forum, aside from the given links that you can read as reference.Don't forget these threads too.For newbies to read --> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0Forum rules --> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0Enjoy your stay and have fun!

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss There is no such thing as a "risk-free" investment. If you decide to invest in something, you should be prepared to suffer losses due to a variety of factors, including depreciation, inflation, and volatility. Therefore, it means that not everybody should invest.You would be better off working in company, as other members have suggested. Plus, being involve in the cryptocurrency market would require you a thorough research that would support your financial decision, otherwise you could lose thousands of dollars in a matter of second.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss If you can't afford loss, it basically means you wouldn't invest in anything at all, you wouldn't also start a business in real life, or buy a car, or start your brand, etc; nearly everything we do in life has its own form of risk, but the thing is, it is always preferable to minimize the risk involved when taking a move.Having said that, in the crypto market it is altcoins that are pump and dump coins, and as a newbie that you are you should steer clear of them until maybe when you have the experience; but Bitcoin is great if you are prepared to hold for the long term, but it as well requires patience and understanding of the market; right now i think you should not think about investing in crypto, but garnering knowledge, once you have enough of it, your journey would be seamless.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Welcome, Sandra.True, in this forum you will connect to many people with the same thoughts or different opinions by learning many things, I think you will find something to understand here especially about the crypto industry.As time goes by you make good contributions from your own thinking so now you just need to learn from the bottom until you can understand everything.And see or read the advice given by the oldest person in this forum, maybe it will be meaningful for you as a beginner.Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss Nothing is safe in investing in crypto, everything is high risk. You have to understand that Dump-Pump has often happened in the crypto market, so all of that must be studied.You, as a beginner, must have the fear of not wanting to bear losses from what you invest, so it's better not to do it now until you really understand all forms of risk and also their functions.What was said above, you have a lot to learn to fight fear.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss If you're not ready to loss your money then you'll probably think of a business that has zero probability of you losing your money and as far as I know there are none. You should first of all acknowledge the fact that Bitcoin/crypto is something that one does with the money he/she can afford to lose. Btw welcome to the forum I see that alot of resources have already been recommended for you by several users just do well to check them out most especially the rules and regulations of the forum if you plan on staying long on the forum without encountering any issue.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: To begin, I would like to extend a warm welcome to you for joining us.There is always a risk, especially when investing. You will not gain anything either if you do not put anything at risk. There is a chance to reap rewards when taking risks. Therefore, you can select one of the two. First and foremost, only put money into investments that you can lose. Never use money that was intended for important use. If you are just starting out, only put your extra savings into investments. Additionally, be aware of the numerous rip-offs involving cryptocurrencies promising fixed returns. Any investment promise made by a stranger is a scam. People who send you direct messages should be avoided. In your topic, you will receive responses to all of your inquiries.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMDear mk4Thank you for your Detailed Reply i will read and watch your all suggestion on the links actually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss History should be made with pump and dump and vice versa. If its only pump then how could we sustain a healthy market without having any correction or downtrend. Its not all about up and gains. There should be a balance for it to move forward in a healthy manner. Youll see history in that sequence. Try to check again and its started to become clear for you.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: The first thing you have to do is learn how to invest correctly and safely, for a while it would be better for you to save your money first. Don't rush into Cryptocurrency if you don't fully understand how it works, especially you just said you weren't ready to take the risk of loss. Of course, Cryptocurrency not only allow you to reap profits many times over, but you can also lose all your money overnight. Start learning the basics about how to invest in Cryptocurrency, then you can spend money slowly when you understand all the risks involved.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss You don't rush to invest here, all of that needs learning and experience. I know it won't be as smooth as imagined, but at least with you already having the knowledge, you will do risk management to overcome losses, so all of that needs experience and when you experience a loss it is a normal thing because in cryptocurrency there is a pump and there is also a dump it depends on the trend that is happening in the crypto industry.Arm yourself with more knowledge and learn how to manage finances properly so that you are not greedy and wrong in making investments or dealing with other losses, and I think that many of the suggestions given can help you take action now.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMI joined bitcointalk.org to learn more about the industry, connect with like-minded individuals, and to share my own knowledge and experiences. I look forward to participating in meaningful discussions and contributing to the community in any way I can.You are among the right bunch of people, but there are also a bunch of scammers and spammers around. Your first task is knowing how to filter through the bunch of spam and find actual content which would benefit your Bitcoin journey.One way is to filter based on rank, but this doesn't always work as high ranked members could be spammers and newbies could provide helpful discussions. But filtering by earned merit could work as well. You can also just read content and verify them yourself before internalizing anything. This works with the Bitcoin ideology of verifying and not trusting.Read through posted links. The forum has a repertoire of information, you only need to discover them.The search option would be useful in this task.Good luck on the forum!

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Welcome to this wunderful forum Sandra99, the entire forum member welcome you and wish you the best in the forum.  Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMany Suggestions for me ?As far as I can tell, many senior colleagues have provided you with sufficient links to the forum rules and regulations, as well as the main guidelines you required in the forum.Just try as much as you can to avoid Plagiarism because it is a very serious offense in the forum and will result in your account being permanently banned; therefore, the forum is ready to provide all the types of help and support you require regarding Bitcoin and other Cryptocurrency issues; once again, welcome.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: Hey sandra, welcome to the forum. You can start contributing to this forum now. But first aware of some rules of this forum. Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMI joined bitcointalk.org to learn more about the industry, connect with like-minded individuals, and to share my own knowledge and experiences. I look forward to participating in meaningful discussions and contributing to the community in any way I can.If your sole purpose in joining this forum is to learn more about crypto and blockchain then you are in the right place buddy. start by reading the guidelines and then you can read the threads from various boards on the forum. Spend time on learning. Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMI already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss If you have lazy money in your account and you can afford to lose the amount under any circumstance you can invest in crypto. But if you can't afford to lose, then you stay away from investing money in bitcoin.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMany Suggestions for me ?Plagiarism is against the rules of the forum and the punishment is a permanent ban - and some have already expressed their suspicion that your posts are the work of AI. Also, someone who just came to the forum is certainly not qualified to immediately start discussions about how to make the forum a better place - because first you need to gain some experience to be able to help others with advice.

comments.author: Taskford
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss Save your money on much important thing since crypto will not be for you at first since if you invest so early then provably you encounter such loss that you can't imagine. Better study more information since from this it can test your patience to know something more about cryptocurrency. You have this community to ask if you don't understand anything and they will answer according to what they can contribute to the topic you start to create here.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMHello everyone,Welcome to the forum and you are at the right place if you are looking for supportive as well as experienced, knowledgeable community to have bitcoin related discussion and learn a lot through various threads covering most of the topics.Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:24:32 AMany Suggestions for me ?Just take it as a simple discussion forum where you will discuss your ideas and thoughts and not much complexity but if we treat it as some sort of income generating source then there could be problems for us so take time and learn with time enhancing your knowledge over here.Quote from: Sandra99 on February 06, 2023, 05:54:50 AMactually I have money for Invest  but i am confused about this crypto market I already check history  too much Dump and Pump  i cant afford loss See the first rule of investment is to make your own decisions and invest only what you can afford to loose also.But as you are newbie and want to invest the best option is bitcoin to you and all of us rather then sticking to some shitcoin in hope of getting more at less price as your funds can be gone with next dump situation in these coins.But in bitcoin you have to focused on holding long term period say more then 5+ years for some good returns.Once you understand more about it you will come to know why investment in it is good decision.
